title: Secondary Lymphangioma of Vulva: A Report of Two Cases
patient: A 44-year-old lady presented with multiple vesicles over her genitalia for the duration of 16 years. The lesions oozed out clear fluid. She had undergone a hysterectomy 17 years back for carcinoma of cervix that was preceded and followed by ten sittings of radiotherapy.\nOn examination, there were multiple grouped vesicles over the labia majora with discharge of clear fluid []. There was no inguinal lymphadenopathy. All the baseline investigations including ultrasound of the abdomen were normal. Skin biopsy showed hyperkeratotis, irregular acanthosis, and papillomatosis of the epidermis, with the papillary dermis showing many dilated lymphatics filled with pale, vacuolated secretions []. The patient underwent excision with double V-Y advancement flap cover and is on follow up.
